snippet: A doctor in Hobbs., N.M., Christopher S. Driskill, who was elected the state medical society’s president, now faces the loss of his license over accusations that include sexual relations with patients.
abstract: Dr Christopher S Driskill of Hobbs, NM, recently elected president of New Mexico Medical Society, faces possibility of revocation of his medical license; Driskill's license was suspended following accusations that include sexual relations with patients, drinking on job and patient neglect; no criminal charges have been filed.

byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A doctor in Hobbs., N.M., Christopher S. Driskill, who was elected the state medical society’s president, now faces the loss of his license over accusations that include sexual relations with patients.

headline.main: In New Mexico, Deliverer of a Town’s Children Faces Salacious Accusations
headline.print_headline: Deliverer of a Town’s Children Faces Salacious Accusations That He Violated Its Trust
